thread.title: Trump Administration Lawyers Ask Court To Reinstate Travel Ban
thread.title_full: Trump Administration Lawyers Ask Court To Reinstate Travel Ban

author: Cristian Farias
title: Trump Administration Lawyers Ask Court To Reinstate Travel Ban

organizations.name: trump administration lawyers ask court to reinstate travel ban trump administration lawyers ask court to reinstate travel

text:
Trump Administration Lawyers Ask Court To Reinstate Travel Ban 02/07/2017 06:05 pm ET Cristian Farias Legal Affairs Reporter, The Huffington Post 
Less than three weeks after President Donald Trump took office, lawyers for his administration were in federal appeals court on Tuesday hoping to convince a panel of judges to reinstate an executive order excluding refugees and immigrants from seven Muslim-majority nations from the country. 
The order imposing a de facto travel ban caused widespread chaos in the days after its implementation, and has been the target of dozens of lawsuits across the country. Last week, a federal judge in Seattle blocked the order’s implementation nationwide . 
But the hearing at the U.S. Court of Appeals for the 9th Circuit, based in San Francisco, could be a bellwether for the order’s legality ― as well as an important test for the limits of executive authority over immigration and the power of courts to check that authority. 
Washington Solicitor General Noah Purcell is representing the states of Washington and Minnesota in urging the 9th Circuit to keep the travel ban on hold until a later time, while August Flentje is urging for its reinstatement for the Trump administration and the Department of Justice. 
Prior to the hearing, a court representative for the 9th Circuit announced that a ruling in the case is not expected until later in the week. 
You can listen to a live feed of the court hearing above or at this link . 
This is a developing story. Check back for updates. More:
